title: Install AutoTester
description: Download and install AutoTester CLI tool globally on your system. This will give you access to all AutoTester commands and features.
subSteps: Open your terminal or command prompt
Check the version to confirm it's working

title: Initialize Your Project
description: Set up AutoTester in your project directory. This creates the necessary configuration files and folder structure for your test automation.
subSteps: Navigate to your project root directory
codeExample:
cd your-project-directory
autotester init
# Follow the prompts to configure your project

title: Configure API Settings
description: Connect AutoTester to your testing environment by configuring API endpoints, authentication, and environment variables.
subSteps: Open the generated config file in your editor
Add your API endpoints and credentials
Test the connection to verify everything works

title: Run Your First Test
description: Execute your first automated test to verify everything is working correctly. AutoTester will analyze your test scenarios and provide intelligent suggestions.
subSteps: Create a simple test case in the tests directory
Run the test using AutoTester CLI
Review the test results and AI insights
Iterate and improve based on recommendations
codeExample:
autotester run --test=welcome
# Or run all tests
autotester run --all
